New Records: Parker Meadows hit the second-fastest pitch a Tigers player has homered off of in the pitch-tracking era, behind only Jeimer Candelario's homer off of 102.1 mph pitch on Sept. 7, 2018.
Key Match Events: Parker Meadows hit a grand slam on a full count with two outs in the ninth inning to give the Detroit Tigers a 4-3 victory over the San Diego Padres.
Tigers reliever Ricky Vanasco (1-0) won his first game of the season with a scoreless eighth.
Tyler Holton earned his seventh save with a scoreless ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: Padres starter Martin Pérez kept the Tigers off balance by mixing his assortment of pitches effectively.
Padres closer Robert Suarez had a good heater and Meadows knew he had to get on top of it.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said, “There is a lot of fight in this group. There is a lot of desire to be good and finish these games.”
Meadows said, “Never count us out. You have seen it all year and we were able to do it again tonight, so it was pretty fun.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: San Diego (80-62) had its three-game winning streak stopped and remained three games ahead of Arizona for the top NL wild card.
Detroit (71-70) is five games behind Kansas City for the last AL wild card, tied with Seattle.
Others: Fernando Tatis Jr. went 0 for 4 on Thursday night after hitting an RBI single with two outs in the 10th inning to give the Padres a 6-5 victory over the Tigers on Wednesday night.
Other Details: Padres starter Martin Pérez went 6 1/3 innings and gave up no runs and three hits while striking out five.
Tigers starter Casey Mize lasted 5 1/3 innings and gave up three runs on six hits.
